Package model

Class ManagerRole

java.lang.Object
model.abstracts.AEmployee
model.StaffRole
model.ManagerRole
public class ManagerRole extends StaffRole
The ManagerRole contains the methods to handle the responsibilities of the manager in the ordering system. It is responsible for retrieving the list of staffs supervised by the manager and updates the menu textfile. It extends the StaffRole model class StaffRole.

  • Constructor Details

    • ManagerRole

      public ManagerRole(String Name, String StaffID, String Role, String Gender, int Age, String Branch, String Password)
      The constructor for ManagerRole takes in the Staff information which calls the superclass constructor of StaffRole class.
      Parameters:
      Name - The name of the staff.
      StaffID - The unique identifier of each employee in the Organisation.
      Role - The role the staff plays in the Organisation. In this case, the manager.
      Gender - The gender of the staff.
      Age - How old is the staff.
      Branch - The division the manager is supervising.
      Password - The unqiue phrase or word to login to the system.

  • Method Details

    • loadBranches

      public Branch loadBranches()
      Abstract the branch that the manager is supervising from the list of branches.
      Returns:
      The branch that the manager resides in.

    • retrieveBranchStaff

      public List<model.abstracts.AEmployee> retrieveBranchStaff(Branch branch)
      Retrieve the list of staffs that are working in the same branch as the manager.
      Returns:
      The list of staffs that is working in the same branch.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(model.menus.MenuItem itemName, Branch selectedBranch)
      Method that is called from the ManagerController to add the new item to the menu textfile based on the particular branch, so that the customer have more options to choose from.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The new item which consists of the item name, item description, item price, the branch it is adding to and the item category.
      selectedBranch - The branch which the manager is working at.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(String itemName, Branch selectedBranch)
      Method that is called from the ManagerController to remove the existing item from the menu textfile based on the particular branch.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the existing item.
      selectedBranch - The branch which the manager is working at.

    • editName

      public void editName(String oldName, String itemName, Branch selectedBranch)
      Method that is called from the ManagerController to edit the name of the existing item from the menu textfile based on the particular branch.
      Parameters:
      oldName - The current name of the existing item in the menu textfile.
      itemName - The new name to be updated to the menu textfile.
      selectedBranch - The branch which the manager is working at.

    • editPrice

      public void editPrice(String itemName, double price, Branch selectedBranch)
      Method that is called from the ManagerController to edit the price of the existing item from the menu textfile based on the particular branch.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the existing item in the menu textfile.
      price - The new price to be updated to the menu textfile.
      selectedBranch - The branch which the manager is working at.

    • editDescription

      public void editDescription(String name, String description, Branch selectedBranch)
      Method that is called from the ManagerController to edit the description of the existing item from the menu textfile based on the particular branch.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the existing item in the menu textfile.
      description - The new description of the item to be updated to the menu textfile.
      selectedBranch - The branch which the manager is working at.

    • itemAvailable

      public boolean itemAvailable(String itemName, Branch selectedBranch)
      Checks if the item to be updated is already in the menu textfile before adding, removing or editing the item.
      Returns:
      A boolean that indicates whether the item is available or not in the menu textfile. - true if the item is in the menu textfile. - false if the item is not in the menu textfile.
